intro: Alcantarea cerosa, commonly known as the rock almond or white rock almond, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, white or pale blue flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid native habitat. Alcantarea cerosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
